title: HMI Display Intermittent Reboot Troubleshooting
content: If the cabin display panel turns off and reboots intermittently, first check the power supply stability to the HMI unit. Loose connectors, fluctuating voltage, or firmware corruption may be the root causes. Re-seat all connectors firmly. If issue persists, replace the HMI module.

title: Power Rail Voltage Diagnostics
content: Power instability during load transitions can lead to component reboot or communication glitches. Use a digital oscilloscope or multimeter to verify voltage consistency on the +24V and +12V lines under full elevator load. Shielding cable replacement may improve power integrity.

title: Audio Announcement System Check
content: If audio announcements fail during display reboots, check shared power and communication paths between HMI and the speaker controller. Inspect logs and verify firmware integrity. Ensure the speaker board firmware is compatible with the HMI firmware version.

title: Landing Door Sensor Maintenance
content: Landing door not closing may be caused by obstruction, magnetic sensor misalignment, or control board signal error. It is recommended to check each door’s close status indicator.
